creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: two men fighting with an epée (or fencing sword) and a dagger in each hand; man at L leans away from the epée near his neck at PL side; man at R is leaning forward, deflecting the sword with his dagger in PL hand
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold August 9, 1983, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Duel with Sword and Dagger, From Les Caprices
